conclusion: Use Faraday's Law of Electromagnetic Induction to find the induced EMF in a rotating coil.
The formula for induced EMF is given by \( \mathcal{E} = n B A \omega \sin(\omega t) \).
Timing starts when the coil plane passes through the neutral plane, at \( t = 0 \), \( \sin(\omega t) = 0 \).
Maximum induced EMF occurs when \( \sin(\omega t) = 1 \).
Calculate the area of the coil: \( A = l_{AB} \times l_{BC} = 0.2 \, \text{m} \times 0.5 \, \text{m} = 0.1 \, \text{m}^2 \).
Substitute the given values: \( n = 100 \), \( B = 0.1 \, \text{T} \), \( A = 0.1 \, \text{m}^2 \), \( \omega = 100\pi \, \text{rad/s} \).
Calculate the maximum induced EMF: \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = n B A \omega \).
Substitute values into the EMF formula: \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = 100 \times 0.1 \, \text{T} \times 0.1 \, \text{m}^2 \times 100\pi \, \text{rad/s} \).
The magnitude of the induced electromotive force in the coil is approximately \( 314.16 \, \text{V} \).
